name: compliment
trans: n. 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺 vt. 恭维；称赞

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: flattering
trans: adj. 奉承的；谄媚的

name: greedy
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪吃的；渴望的

sentences.english: a greedy and selfish society
sentences.chinese: 一个贪婪自私的社会

sentences.english: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。

sentences.english: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
sentences.chinese: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: humble
trans: adj. 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的 vt. 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: persistence
trans: n. 持续；固执；存留；坚持不懈；毅力

sentences.english: Her persistence paid off when she was offered the job of manager.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了经理的职位，不懈坚持终于有了回报。

sentences.english: ‘Why can’t I come?’ repeated Will with dogged persistence .
sentences.chinese: “我为什么不能去？”威尔不死心地又问了一遍。

detailed_translations.english: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it

name: strength
trans: n. 力量；力气；兵力；长处

sentences.english: The police force is below strength at the moment (= there are fewer police than there should be ).
sentences.chinese: 目前警力不足。

sentences.english: the strength of a rope
sentences.chinese: 绳子的强度

detailed_translations.english: the number of people in a team, army etc

name: competitive
trans: adj. 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

name: cooperate
trans: vi. 合作，配合；协力

sentences.english: They agreed to co-operate with Brazil on a programme to protect the rain forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们同意和巴西合作进行一个保护热带雨林的项目。

sentences.english: I advised my client to cooperate fully with the police.
sentences.chinese: 我建议我的当事人要全力与警方配合。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

name: matriarch
trans: n. 女家长；女统治者；女负责人；受人尊敬的妇女

detailed_translations.chinese: 女家长；女统治者；女负责人；受人尊敬的妇女
detailed_translations.english: a woman, especially an older woman, who controls a family or a social group

name: predator
trans: n. [动] 捕食者；[动] 食肉动物；掠夺者

sentences.english: With no natural predators on the island, the herd increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 由于岛上没有天然食肉动物，牧群的数量迅速增加。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that kills and eats other animals

name: solitary
trans: adj. 孤独的；独居的 n. 独居者；隐士

sentences.english: a long, solitary walk
sentences.chinese: 独自一人的长距离散步

detailed_translations.english: doing something without anyone else with you
someone who lives completely alone

name: young
trans: adj. 年轻的；初期的；没有经验的 n. 年轻人；（动物的）崽，仔 n. (Young)人名；(中)杨(广东话·威妥玛)；(柬)永；(英、葡)扬

sentences.english: a young child
sentences.chinese: 幼儿

sentences.english: He’s younger than me.
sentences.chinese: 他比我小。

sentences.english: You’re too young to get married.
sentences.chinese: 你还太小，不能结婚。

sentences.english: young trees
sentences.chinese: 小树

sentences.english: When I was young, I wanted to be a model.
sentences.chinese: 我年轻时候想当模特。

sentences.english: John was a great footballer in his younger days(= when he was younger ).
sentences.chinese: 约翰年轻时是个很棒的足球运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 年轻的；初期的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: a young person, plant, or animal has not lived for very long
young people

name: compassion
trans: n. 同情；怜悯

sentences.english: I was shocked by the doctor’s lack of compassion .
sentences.chinese: 我对这个医生如此缺乏同情心感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of sympathy for someone who is suffering, and a desire to help them

name: devotion
trans: n. 献身，奉献；忠诚；热爱

sentences.english: her devotion to duty
sentences.chinese: 她对职责的忠诚

sentences.english: Her devotion to the job left her with very little free time.
sentences.chinese: 她全身心投入工作，几乎没有闲暇。

detailed_translations.english: the action of spending a lot of time or energy on sth

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显 vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: instinct
trans: n. 本能，直觉；天性 adj. 充满着的

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: loyalty
trans: n. 忠诚；忠心；忠实；忠于…感情

sentences.english: Elizabeth understood her husband’s loyalty to his sister.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白理解丈夫对他姐姐的一片忠心。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of remaining faithful to your friends, principles, country etc

name: passive
trans: adj. 被动的，消极的；被动语态的 n. 被动语态

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: hoax
trans: n. 恶作剧；骗局；谎报 v. 捉弄，欺骗

sentences.english: a bomb hoax
sentences.chinese: 虚假炸弹恐吓

sentences.english: (= telephone calls giving false information ) to the police
sentences.chinese: 恶作剧报警电话

detailed_translations.english: a false warning about something dangerous

name: media
trans: n. 媒体；媒质（medium的复数）；血管中层；浊塞音；中脉

sentences.english: The scandal was widely reported in the national media .
sentences.chinese: 这一丑闻在全国媒体上被广泛报道。

sentences.english: The role of the news media in forming public opinion is very important.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体对于社会舆论的形成具有非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: The 11-day trial generated intense media interest .
sentences.chinese: 11天的审讯引起了媒体的高度关注。

sentences.english: A great deal of media hype surrounded the release of the group’s latest CD.
sentences.chinese: 媒体对这个组合最新唱片的发行进行了大肆炒作。

sentences.english: There will be another war somewhere else and the whole international media circus will move on.
sentences.chinese: 别的地方还会有战争，全球的媒体又会一窝蜂地拥过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新闻媒介， 传播媒介
detailed_translations.english: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work

name: naive
trans: adj. 天真的,幼稚的

sentences.english: a naive young girl
sentences.chinese: 天真的小女孩

sentences.english: Jim can be so naive sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆有时候非常幼稚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼稚的； 天真的； 轻信的
detailed_translations.english: not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen

name: prank
trans: n. 恶作剧，开玩笑；戏谑 vt. 装饰；打扮 vi. 炫耀自己；胡闹

sentences.english: a childish prank
sentences.chinese: 孩子气的恶作剧

detailed_translations.english: a trick, especially one which is played on someone to make them look silly
to dress or decorate showily or gaudily

name: traditional
trans: adj. 传统的；惯例的

sentences.english: traditional Italian cooking
sentences.chinese: 传统的意大利烹饪

sentences.english: a traditional Irish folk song
sentences.chinese: 传统的爱尔兰民歌

sentences.english: a traditional method of brewing beer
sentences.chinese: 传统的啤酒酿造方法

detailed_translations.english: being part of the traditions of a country or group of people

name: victim
trans: n. 受害人，牺牲品，牺牲者；受骗者，上当的人；祭品，牺牲；无助者，被动者

sentences.english: The victim received head injuries from which she died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 受害人头部受伤，一周后死亡。

sentences.english: a credit card fraud ring that stole millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims
sentences.chinese: 从毫无戒心的受害者手中盗取数百万美元的信用卡诈骗团伙

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培 vt. [细胞][微] 培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: elect
trans: v. 选举；选择，决定（做某事）；（上帝）挑选（某人）（使其灵魂永远得救） adj. 卓越的；蒙上帝挑选（而得救）的；当选（而尚未就职的） n. 被选的人；上帝的选民；特权集体

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: festival
trans: n. 节日；庆祝，纪念活动；欢乐 adj. 节日的，喜庆的；快乐的

sentences.english: the Swansea Festival of Music and the Arts
sentences.chinese: 斯旺西音乐艺术节

sentences.english: Christmas is one of the main festivals in the Christian Calendar.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节是基督教历的重大节日之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔电影、戏剧、音乐等的〕节，节庆，会演；节日
detailed_translations.english: an occasion when there are performances of many films, plays, pieces of music etc, usually happening in the same place every year

name: gaucho
trans: n. 加乌乔人（居住于南美大草原上的印第安人和西班牙人的混血种族）

detailed_translations.english: a South American cowboy

name: province
trans: n. 省；领域；职权

sentences.english: Computers were once the exclusive province of scientists and mathematicians.
sentences.chinese: 计算机一度为科学家和数学家专用。

detailed_translations.english: a subject that someone knows a lot about or something that only they are responsible for

name: textile
trans: n. 纺织品，织物 adj. 纺织的

sentences.english: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要出口商品是纺织品，尤其是丝绸和棉布。

detailed_translations.english: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc

name: abandon
trans: v. 遗弃；离开；放弃；终止；陷入 n. 放任，狂热

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: cannon
trans: n. 大炮；加农炮；榴弹炮；机关炮 vi. 炮轰；开炮 vt. 炮轰 n. (Cannon)人名；(英、葡)坎农

sentences.english: The cannons boom, the band plays.
sentences.chinese: 炮声隆隆，鼓乐齐鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大炮；加农炮；榴弹炮；机关炮
detailed_translations.english: a large heavy powerful gun that was used in the past to fire heavy metal balls

name: flee
trans: vi. 逃走；消失，消散 vt. 逃跑，逃走；逃避

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: fort
trans: n. 堡垒；要塞；（美）边界贸易站 vt. 设要塞保卫 vi. 构筑要塞 n. (Fort)人名；(法)福尔；(德、英、西、葡、匈)福特

sentences.english: The fort flanked on a swamp.
sentences.chinese: 堡垒侧面靠着沼泽。

detailed_translations.english: a strong building or group of buildings used by soldiers or an army for defending an important place

name: ransack
trans: vt. 洗劫，掠夺；遍寻

name: degree
trans: n. 程度，等级；度；学位；阶层

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

name: ethnicity
trans: n. 种族划分

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权 n. (Heritage)人名；(英)赫里蒂奇

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: injustice
trans: n. 不公正；不讲道义

sentences.english: The movie deals with injustices suffered by Native Americans.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影讲述印第安人受到的不公正待遇。

sentences.english: He had developed a deep sense of social injustice.
sentences.chinese: 他深深感到社会的不公。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people are treated very unfairly and not given their rights

name: race
trans: n. 属，种；种族，人种；家庭，门第；赛事，赛跑 vt. 使参加比赛；和…竞赛；使急走，使全速行进 vi. 比速度，参加竞赛；全速行进 n. (Race)人名；(英)雷斯；(塞)拉采

sentences.english: The race is on to develop more environmentally friendly forms of energy.
sentences.chinese: 人们正在竞相开发更环保的能源形式。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does

name: biologist
trans: n. 生物学家

sentences.english: Similarly, every time a biologist discovers a new species, there is the opportunity to honour someone or something.
sentences.chinese: 类似地，每次一位生物学家发现一个新物种，就又有了一个纪念某人或某事的机会。

sentences.english: One biologist developed a formula for how much genetic material would have to be to saved in the act of altruism for it to be worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 一位生物学家发展了一套公式，用来计算到底有多少遗传物质可以被保留下来的时候，利他的行为才是值得的。

sentences.english: An evolutionary biologist would say physical activity is the only voluntary means you have of varying or regulating your energy expenditure.
sentences.chinese: 一个进化生物学家会说体力活动是唯一的志愿就是你的不同或管理您的能源开支的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or works in biology

name: carnivore
trans: n. [动] 食肉动物；食虫植物

sentences.english: This is a delicious vegetarian dish that even carnivores love.
sentences.chinese: 这是一道肉食者们都喜欢的美味素食。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that eats flesh

name: extinction
trans: n. 灭绝；消失；消灭；废止

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing

name: hibernate
trans: vi. 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒

sentences.english: Dormice hibernate from October to May.
sentences.chinese: 睡鼠从10月到5月冬眠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒
detailed_translations.english: if an animal hibernates, it sleeps for the whole winter

name: muzzle
trans: n. 枪口，炮口；口套，口络；动物的鼻口 vt. 使…缄默；给…戴口套；封锁…的言论

sentences.english: The mongrel presented his muzzle for scratching.
sentences.chinese: 这只杂种狗探出口鼻挠痒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 枪口，炮口；口套，口络；动物的鼻口
detailed_translations.english: a cover that you put over a dog’s mouth to stop it from biting people

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…缄默；给…戴口套；封锁…的言论
detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone from saying what they think in public

name: omnivore
trans: n. [动] 杂食动物；不偏食的人

sentences.english: But I don’t care if you’re an omnivore.
sentences.chinese: 但是我也不会介意你是否是杂食动物。

sentences.english: He's an 18)omnivore, and what a trainer would call food-driven.
sentences.chinese: 他是杂食动物，驯兽师称之为“食物驱动型”。

detailed_translations.chinese: [动] 杂食动物；不偏食的人
detailed_translations.english: an animal that eats both meat and plants

name: contact
trans: n. 接触，联系 vt. 使接触，联系 vi. 使接触，联系

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

name: information
trans: n. 信息，资料；知识；情报

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

name: interview
trans: n. 接见，采访；面试，面谈 vt. 采访；接见；对…进行面谈；对某人进行面试

sentences.english: a portfolio of work presented at interview
sentences.chinese: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本

sentences.english: a police interview
sentences.chinese: 警方问讯

sentences.english: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

name: invertebrate
trans: adj. 无脊椎的；无骨气的 n. 无脊椎动物；无骨气的人

sentences.english: Concept artist Terryl Whitlatch wanted the colo claw fish to have an invertebrate look, so her early designs were based on an earwig.
sentences.chinese: 概念画家特丽尔·惠特拉奇希望科洛爪鱼拥有无脊椎动物的外表，所以她的早期设计是以蠼螋为基础的。

sentences.english: There was a hierarchical system in neurobiology, and working in invertebrate animals was not looked upon favorably, except in a very special case: the squid giant axon.
sentences.chinese: 神经生物学中有一个等级系统，无脊椎动物的研究不被看好，除了非常特殊的例子：枪乌贼巨大的轴突。

sentences.english: Smithers, don't you think it's ironic that your irregular night-time activities are in inverse proportion to your reputation as an expert in the area of invertebrate research?
sentences.chinese: 斯密德斯，难道你不认为自己无规律的夜生活与你作为无脊椎动物研究领域的专家的声望成反比是具有讽刺意味的吗？

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that does not have a  backbone

name: molt
trans: vi. 脱毛；换毛 n. 换毛；脱皮；换毛期 vt. 脱毛；换毛 n. (Molt)人名；(德、捷)莫尔特

sentences.english: Like other penguins, it undergoes an annual molt, replacing all its feathers in a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 和其他企鹅一样，它也经历一年一次的脱毛，在几周时间里替换掉所有的羽毛。

sentences.english: He said emperor penguins can spend months at a time in the ocean, coming ashore only to molt or rest, but did not know what might have caused this particular one to become disoriented.
sentences.chinese: 他说帝企鹅可以一次性在海里带上数月，上岸只是为了脱毛换羽和休息。 但不知道是什么造成了这只特别的企鹅变得分不清楚方向。

name: species
trans: n. [生物] 物种；种类 adj. 物种上的

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: glacier
trans: n. 冰河，冰川

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: Inuit
trans: n. 因纽特人；因纽特语 adj. 因纽特人的；因纽特语的

sentences.english: He pays heed to the observations of the Inuit.
sentences.chinese: 他留意到因纽特人的观察结果。

sentences.english: The involvement of the Inuit is crucial also because alterations brought on by climate change increase the chances of intervention in their lifestyle - impossible a decade ago.
sentences.chinese: 因纽特人的参与之所以至关重要，还因为气候变化带来的改变增加了他们的生活方式受到干扰的可能性——这在十年前是不可能的。

sentences.english: Whales have long been central part of Inuit life in Greenland, where a regulated subsistence hunt continues to this day.
sentences.chinese: 在格陵兰，猎鲸是长期以来因纽特人生活的中心内容，在那里，受规管的自给狩猎一直持续至今。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因纽特人,  因纽特语
detailed_translations.english: The Inuit are the people descended from the original people of Alaska, Eastern Canada, and Greenland

name: Métis
trans: adj. 混血儿的 n. 混血儿

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: apology
trans: n. 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物

sentences.english: Edward can’t be here today, but he sends his apologies .
sentences.chinese: 爱德华今天来不了，他向大家表示歉意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

name: hesitate
trans: vi. 踌躇，犹豫；不愿 vt. 踌躇，犹豫；有疑虑，不愿意

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: linger
trans: vi. 徘徊；苟延残喘；磨蹭 vt. 消磨；缓慢度过 n. (Linger)人名；(德、捷、瑞典)林格；(法)兰热

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable

name: mimic
trans: vt. 模仿，摹拟 n. 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑 adj. 模仿的，模拟的；假装的

sentences.english: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
sentences.chinese: 他能模仿所有老师的口音。

sentences.english: ‘I’m so sorry,’ she mimicked.
sentences.chinese: “很抱歉。”她学着说道。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑

name: mischievous
trans: adj. 淘气的；（人、行为等）恶作剧的；有害的

sentences.english: Their sons are noisy and mischievous.
sentences.chinese: 他们的几个儿子又吵又淘气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 淘气的；（人、行为等）恶作剧的；有害的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is mischievous likes to have fun, especially by playing tricks on people or doing things to annoy or embarrass them

name: unpleasant
trans: adj. 讨厌的；使人不愉快的

sentences.english: an unpleasant experience
sentences.chinese: 不愉快的经历

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant smell
sentences.chinese: 极其难闻的味道

sentences.english: an unpleasant surprise
sentences.chinese: 令人不快的意外

detailed_translations.english: not pleasant or enjoyable

name: break
trans: v. 打破；（人或动物）骨折；擦破（皮肤）；违犯；弄坏；（机器）失灵；打断（连续性）；（天气）突变；（新闻）突然传开；终止 n. 间断；休息；短假；缺口；破裂；进攻；骨折；结束；机会；（斯诺克）一次连续得分；蓓蕾

sentences.english: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

detailed_translations.english: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

name: cryptographic
trans: adj. 关于暗号的，用密码写的

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: Navajo
trans: n. 纳瓦霍人（美国最大的印第安部落）

name: reservation
trans: n. 预约，预订；保留

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: captivity
trans: n. 囚禁；被关

sentences.english: The hostages were released from captivity.
sentences.chinese: 人质被释放了。

detailed_translations.english: when a person or animal is kept in a prison,  cage  etc and not allowed to go where they want

name: carrion
trans: n. （动物的）腐肉；不洁之物 adj. 腐肉的；腐朽的 n. (Carrion) （美、西）卡里翁（人名）

sentences.english: Proletarian, be aware of the raid to the USSR planned by the carrion crows!
sentences.chinese: 无产者们，要看到由吃腐肉的乌鸦计划的突袭苏联行动！

sentences.english: In India, veterinary use of the drug Diclofenac may be largely responsible for the crash in vulture and other carrion bird populations.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，秃鹫以及其他以腐肉为食的鸟类数量大量减少可能主要归咎于兽医对双氯芬酸的使用。

detailed_translations.english: the decaying flesh of dead animals, which is eaten by some animals and birds

name: current
trans: adj. 现在的；流通的，通用的；最近的；草写的 n. （水，气，电）流；趋势；涌流 n. (Current)人名；(英)柯伦特

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: decompose
trans: vt. 分解；使腐烂 vi. 分解；腐烂

sentences.english: a partially decomposed body
sentences.chinese: 部分腐烂的尸体

detailed_translations.english: to decay or make something decay

name: refuge
trans: n. 避难；避难所；庇护 vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难 vi. 避难；逃避

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: wingspan
trans: n. 翼展；翼幅

sentences.english: ...a glider with an 18-foot wingspan.
sentences.chinese: ...一架翼幅为18英尺的滑翔机。

detailed_translations.english: the distance from the end of one wing to the end of the other

name: boundary
trans: n. 边界；范围；分界线

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: complicated
trans: adj. 难懂的，复杂的

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: draw
trans: vt. 画；拉；吸引 vi. 拉；拖 n. 平局；抽签 n. (Draw)人名；(英)德劳

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: fielding
trans: n. 守备；防守 v. 保护；担任外场员（field的ing形式）

name: international
trans: adj. 国际的；国际通用的 n. 国际体育比赛（选手）；外国人 n. (International) 共产国际（组织）

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: umpire
trans: n. 裁判员，仲裁人 v. 仲裁，裁判；当裁判，任裁判

sentences.english: He umpired baseball games.
sentences.chinese: 他过去担任棒球比赛的裁判。

detailed_translations.english: to be the umpire in a game or competition
the person who makes sure that the players obey the rules in sports such as tennis, baseball, and cricket

name: conjurer
trans: n. 魔术师；巫师

name: desperate
trans: adj. 不顾一切的；令人绝望的；极度渴望的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: fabric
trans: n. 织物；布；组织；构造；建筑物

sentences.english: our new range of fabrics and wallpapers
sentences.chinese: 我们新的织物和墙纸系列

sentences.english: The country’s social fabric is disintegrating.
sentences.chinese: 该国的社会结构正在瓦解。

detailed_translations.english: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

name: potion
trans: n. 一剂；一服；饮剂

sentences.english: a magic potion
sentences.chinese: 魔法药水

sentences.english: a love potion
sentences.chinese: 春药饮剂

detailed_translations.english: a drink intended to have a special or magical effect on the person who drinks it, or which is intended to poison them

name: scraping
trans: n. 刮削下的碎屑；刮擦声；抹去 adj. 刮擦的；吝啬的 v. 刮，擦（scrape的现在分词）

sentences.english: I can't bear the sound of chalk scraping on a blackboard.
sentences.chinese: 我忍受不了粉笔在黑板上的刮擦声。

sentences.english: Elephants and other animals could walk freely without scraping their head on the ceiling -- with plenty of room to spare.
sentences.chinese: 大象和其他动物可以自由走动而不让天花板刮到它们的头部——那里有着充足的备用空间。

sentences.english: Or, like me, you can go back and forth, alternatively scraping off the accumulated gunk and making yourself more accessible by taking on more of it.
sentences.chinese: 或者像我一样，你可以后退或者前进，抑或是刮去那堆堆积物，通过呈现更多使你自己变得更加容易接近。

detailed_translations.english: the act of scraping

name: sorrow
trans: n. 悲伤；懊悔；伤心事 vi. 懊悔；遗憾；感到悲伤 vt. 为…悲痛

sentences.english: the family’s joys and sorrows
sentences.chinese: 这家人的喜与悲

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great sadness, usually because someone has died or because something terrible has happened to you
to feel or express sorrow

name: explanation
trans: n. 说明，解释；辩解

sentences.english: She told the court she would give a full explanation of the prosecution's decision on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉法庭她将在星期一就控方的决定做出详尽的解释。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why sth happened; a reason given for sth

name: gloomy
trans: adj. 黑暗的；沮丧的；阴郁的

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

name: proactive
trans: adj. 前摄的（前一活动中的因素对后一活动造成影响的）；有前瞻性的，先行一步的；积极主动的

sentences.english: a proactive approach to staffing requirements
sentences.chinese: 对人事需求的积极处理方法

detailed_translations.chinese: 积极主动的； 先发制人的
detailed_translations.english: making things happen or change rather than reacting to events

name: terrified
trans: v. （使）害怕，惊恐；恐吓（terrify 的过去式及过去分词） adj. 非常害怕的，极度惊恐的

sentences.english: a terrified little girl
sentences.chinese: 一个惊恐万分的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: very frightened

name: tome
trans: n. 大部头巨著；（几卷中的）一册 n. (Tome) （美、巴西、西、葡）托梅（人名）

detailed_translations.chinese: 册， 大部头书； 巨著
detailed_translations.english: a large heavy book

name: baguette
trans: n. 法国棍子面包；成长方形的宝石 n. (Baguette)人名；(法)巴盖特

name: carnival
trans: n. 狂欢节，嘉年华会；饮宴狂欢

sentences.english: preparations for this year’s carnival
sentences.chinese: 今年狂欢节的准备工作

sentences.english: when it’s Carnival in Rio
sentences.chinese: 里约热内卢举行狂欢节的时候

sentences.english: a carnival atmosphere in the town
sentences.chinese: 城里的狂欢气氛

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂欢节，嘉年华会；饮宴狂欢
detailed_translations.english: a public event at which people play music, wear special clothes, and dance in the streets

name: cathedral
trans: n. 大教堂

sentences.english: This Gothic cathedral has attracted visitors from all around the world .
sentences.chinese: 这座哥特式的大教堂吸引了世界各地的游客。

sentences.english: Rosie gray is the one and only person , if it had not been for her , this crystal cathedral would not be here.
sentences.chinese: 她就是那一位，唯一的一人若没有她，水晶宫大教堂不会存在，这事工永远不会展开。

detailed_translations.english: the main church of a particular area under the control of a  bishop

name: fashion
trans: n. 时尚；时装；样式；方式；时髦人物 vt. 使用；改变；做成…的形状

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: gorge
trans: n. 峡谷；胃；暴食；咽喉；障碍物 vt. 使吃饱；吞下；使扩张 vi. 拚命吃；狼吞虎咽 n. (Gorge)人名；(西)戈赫；(法)戈尔热

sentences.english: I could spend each day gorging on chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 我可以将每一天都花在狂吃巧克力上。

detailed_translations.english: If you gorge on something or gorge yourself on it, you eat lots of it in a very greedy way
a deep narrow valley with steep sides

name: vineyard
trans: n. 葡萄园

sentences.english: The wine was bottled near the vineyard.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒在葡萄园附近被装瓶封藏。

sentences.english: What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?
sentences.chinese: 这样，葡萄园的主人，要怎样处治他们呢。

sentences.english: They kept a careful watch over the vineyard throughout the growing season.
sentences.chinese: 在整个生长季节， 他们都认真地守着葡萄园。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land where grapevines are grown in order to produce wine

name: abolition
trans: n. 废除；废止

sentences.english: The abolition of slavery in Brazil and the Caribbean closely followed the pattern of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 巴西和加勒比海地区对奴隶制的废除很大程度上遵循了美国的模式。

sentences.english: Yes, I have wanted to be an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想过成为一个宇航员。

sentences.english: Many different qualities go towards the making of an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 一名宇航员必须具备许多不同的素质。

detailed_translations.english: someone who travels and works in a spacecraft

name: launch
trans: v. 发射（导弹、火箭等）；发起，发动；使……下水；开始；起飞 n. 发射；发行，投放市场；下水；汽艇

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: space station
trans: 空间站，太空站

detailed_translations.english: a large spacecraft that stays above the Earth and is a base for people travelling in space or for scientific tests

name: training
trans: n. 训练；培养；瞄准；整枝 v. 训练；教养（train的ing形式）

sentences.english: Police drivers have to undergo intensive training .
sentences.chinese: 警察驾驶员都得接受强化训练。

sentences.english: a rigorous training session
sentences.chinese: 一节严格的训练课

sentences.english: On-the-job training will be supplemented by classroom lectures.
sentences.chinese: 除了在职培训，还将有课堂授课作为补充。

sentences.english: The shop opens late on Fridays because of staff training .
sentences.chinese: 因为员工培训，这家商店周五较晚开门营业。

detailed_translations.english: the process of teaching or being taught the skills for a particular job or activity

name: antic
trans: adj. 古怪的；滑稽可笑的 n. 滑稽动作；丑角 vi. 扮小丑；做滑稽动作 n. (Antic)人名；(法)安蒂克

name: arthritis
trans: n. [外科] 关节炎

sentences.english: I have a touch of arthritis in the wrist.
sentences.chinese: 我的手腕有轻微关节炎。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that causes the joints of your body to become swollen and very painful

name: coma
trans: n. [医] 昏迷；[天] 彗形像差 n. (Coma)人名；(法、西)科马

sentences.english: The sick man went into a coma.
sentences.chinese: 病人进入了昏迷状态。

sentences.english: In the absence of treatment, disease progression results in seizures, stupour and coma.
sentences.chinese: 在不治疗的情况下，病情的发展可导致癫痫发作和昏迷。

sentences.english: He has not ventured outside his tiny house for years because his wife is in a coma, and he does not want her to wake up and find him gone.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他都没有走出自己的小房子出去冒险，因为他的妻子一直昏迷着，他不希望妻子醒来的时候发现自己已经离开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （因严重疾病或重伤引起的）昏迷

name: funeral
trans: n. 葬礼；麻烦事 adj. 丧葬的，出殡的

sentences.english: The funeral will be held at St. Martin’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼将在圣马丁教堂举行。

sentences.english: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 数百名哀悼者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。

sentences.english: the minister who conducted the funeral service
sentences.chinese: 主持葬礼的牧师

sentences.english: Nelson’s funeral procession down the Thames
sentences.chinese: 沿泰晤士河而下为纳尔逊送葬的队伍

sentences.english: Ramdas set fire to the funeral pyre .
sentences.chinese: 拉姆达斯点燃了火葬柴堆。

detailed_translations.english: a religious ceremony for burying or cremating someone who has died

name: paramedic
trans: n. 护理人员；伞兵军医；伞降医务人员

name: stroke
trans: n. （游泳或划船的）划；中风；（打、击等的）一下；冲程；（成功的）举动；尝试；轻抚 vt. （用笔等）画；轻抚；轻挪；敲击；划尾桨；划掉；（打字时）击打键盘 vi. 击球；作尾桨手，指挥划桨；（打字时）击打键盘

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: cure
trans: v. 缓解（人或动物）的疾病症状，治疗；治愈；解决（问题）；（用腌、晒、熏等方法）加工处理，保存（肉、鱼、烟草、兽皮）；被硫化，使硬化；凝固，养护 n. 药物；疗法，治疗；治愈；对策；（对橡胶、塑料或其他材料的）熟化；（基督教牧师的）牧师责任（或责任区）；教区 n. (Cure) （美、法）楚雷（人名）

sentences.english: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

sentences.english: The new treatment effected a miraculous cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种新疗法产生了奇迹般的疗效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
the act of making someone well again after an illness

name: float
trans: v. 使漂浮，浮动；漂流，飘动；飘移；安排（贷款）提出，提请考虑（想法或计划）；发行（股票）上市；（货币汇率）自由浮动实行 n. （酒吧等用于给顾客找零的）备用零钱；彩车，花车；浮板；漂浮物；鱼漂；浮子；加冰激凌的饮料；浮动期；坐浮箱（治病、疗伤或放松）；救生圈 n. (Float)（美、英、德）弗洛特（人名）

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

name: mosaic
trans: n. 马赛克；镶嵌画般的东西；不同要素组合体；（电视摄像机的）感光镶嵌板面；（生）嵌合体；花叶病 v. 用马赛克装饰；整合 adj. （生）镶嵌性的；拼成的；摩西的 n. (Mosaic) （印、美）摩塞克（人名）

sentences.english: rooms decorated with wall paintings and mosaics
sentences.chinese: 用壁画和马赛克装饰的房间

sentences.english: a 3rd-century Roman mosaic floor
sentences.chinese: 三世纪罗马镶嵌地面

detailed_translations.chinese: 摩西的；拼成的；嵌花式的

detailed_translations.english: a pattern or picture made by fitting together small pieces of coloured stone, glass etc

name: polymer
trans: n. [高分子] 聚合物 n. (Polymer)人名；(英)波利默

sentences.english: The nature of the polymer is currently a trade secret.
sentences.chinese: 这一聚合物的性质目前是个商业机密。

sentences.english: Latex, a material obtained from rubber trees, is a natural polymer of isoprene.
sentences.chinese: 乳胶，一种从橡树获得的物质，是天然的异戊二烯聚合物。

sentences.english: The term condensation is now firmly entrenched in the literature of polymer science.
sentences.chinese: 缩合这个术语，现在在聚合物科学文献中已牢固的确定。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical  compound  that has a simple structure of large  molecule s

name: trowel
trans: n. （园艺用的）泥铲；（砌砖用的）[建] 泥刀；（抹灰用的）抹子 vt. 用抹子涂抹；用小泥铲挖

name: boycott
trans: v. 联合抵制；拒绝购买；拒绝参加 n. 联合抵制 n. (Boycott) 博伊科特（人名）

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

name: leadership
trans: n. 领导能力；领导阶层

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

name: march
trans: vi. （坚定地向某地）前进；行军，进军；游行示威；进展，进行 vt. 使前进；使行军 n. 行进，前进；行军；游行示威；进行曲

sentences.english: On 29 August the royal army marched into Inverness.
sentences.chinese: 8月29日皇家军队开进因弗内斯。

sentences.english: The police decided not to ban the march.
sentences.chinese: 警方决定不禁止这次示威游行。

detailed_translations.english: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something

name: resist
trans: vi. 抵抗，抗拒；忍耐 vt. 抵抗；忍耐，忍住 n. [助剂] 抗蚀剂；防染剂

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: segregated
trans: adj. 被隔离的 v. 隔离（segregate的过去式）；分离

name: advise
trans: vt. 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告 vi. 建议；与…商量

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: determined
trans: adj. 决定了的；坚决的 v. 决定；断定（determine的过去分词）

sentences.english: Gwen is a very determined woman.
sentences.chinese: 格温是个意志很坚定的女性。

detailed_translations.english: having a strong desire to do something, so that you will not let anyone stop you

name: diverse
trans: adj. 不同的，相异的；多种多样的，形形色色的

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: encourage
trans: vt. 鼓励，怂恿；激励；支持

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: law
trans: n. 法律；规律；法治；法学；诉讼；司法界 vi. 起诉；控告 vt. 控告；对…起诉 n. (Law)人名；(东南亚国家华语)刘；(英、缅、柬)劳

sentences.english: Elected officials ought to obey the law.
sentences.chinese: 民选官员理应遵守法律。

sentences.english: laws passed by Parliament
sentences.chinese: 议会通过的法律

detailed_translations.english: the whole system of rules that people in a particular country or area must obey

name: ballot
trans: n. 投票；投票用纸；投票总数 vi. 投票；抽签决定 vt. 使投票表决；拉选票 n. (Ballot)人名；(英)巴洛特；(法)巴洛

sentences.english: The party leader is elected by secret ballot .
sentences.chinese: 政党领袖是通过无记名投票选举产生的。

sentences.english: Workers at the plant held a ballot and rejected strike action.
sentences.chinese: 工厂工人举行投票，否决了罢工行动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投票；投票用纸；投票总数
detailed_translations.english: a system of voting, usually in secret, or an occasion when you vote in this way
to ask someone to vote for something

name: district
trans: n. 区域；地方；行政区

sentences.english: a house in a pleasant suburban district
sentences.chinese: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

detailed_translations.english: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features

name: enthusiastic
trans: adj. 热情的；热心的；狂热的

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

name: signature
trans: n. 署名；签名；信号

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: anthropoid
trans: adj. 类人的，（猿等）似人类的；类人猿的；与高等灵长类有关的；（非正式）举止像猿猴的 n. 类人猿；灵长目；（非正式）猿猴似的人

sentences.english: From the point of view of evolution, men originated millions of years ago from the anthropoid, a species commonly referred to as the ape man.
sentences.chinese: 从进化的观点来看，人类起源于几百万年前的类人猿，通常又称作猿人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类人猿的；类人的；（猿等）似人类的
detailed_translations.english: an anthropoid animal, such as an  ape  , looks like a human
any primate of the suborder Anthropoidea, including monkeys, apes, and man

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地 n. (Habitat)人名；(德)哈比塔特

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: prehensile
trans: adj. 适于抓握的；善于领会的

sentences.english: Only the kinkajou's tail is prehensile, like a monkey's, and only the kinkajou has been a pet for Paris Hilton.
sentences.chinese: 二者仅有的不同点在于蜜熊的尾巴像猴子一样可以用来抓握，而且还曾被帕里斯·希尔顿拿来当宠物养。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适于抓握的；善于领会的
detailed_translations.english: a prehensile tail, foot etc can curl around things and hold on to them

name: primate
trans: n. 灵长目动物（包括人、猴子等）；大主教；首领 adj. 灵长目动物的；大主教的

sentences.english: The woolly spider monkey is the largest primate in the Americas.
sentences.chinese: 绒毛蛛猴是美洲最大的灵长目动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大主教；灵长类的动物；首领
detailed_translations.english: a member of the group of animals that includes humans and monkeys

name: prosimian
trans: adj. 原猴亚目的 n. 原猴亚目的猴

name: troop
trans: n. 军队；组；群；多数 vi. 群集；成群而行；结队 vt. 把（骑兵）编成骑兵连

sentences.english: Both countries agreed to withdraw their troops .
sentences.chinese: 两国都同意撤军。

sentences.english: troops stationed in Hawaii
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷的驻军

detailed_translations.english: soldiers in an organized group
if a group of people troop somewhere, they walk there together in a way that shows they are tired or bored

name: aisle
trans: n. 通道，走道；侧廊

sentences.english: Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat (=  seat next to the aisle  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 您想要靠窗的座位还是靠过道的座位？

detailed_translations.english: a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theatre etc, or between rows of shelves in a shop

name: balance
trans: n. 平衡；余额；匀称 vt. 使平衡；结算；使相称 vi. 保持平衡；相称；抵销 n. (Balance)人名；(西)巴兰塞

sentences.english: She balanced the cup on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子在膝盖上放稳。

detailed_translations.english: to put your body or sth else into a position where it is steady and does not fall
an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar

name: ceremony
trans: n. 典礼，仪式；礼节，礼仪；客套，虚礼

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

name: mock
trans: v. 嘲笑，（通过模仿）嘲弄；不尊重，蔑视；使显得可笑 adj. 虚假的，不诚实的；模拟的，仿制的 n. （非正式）英国模拟考试；笑柄；嘲笑；模仿，仿造（品） adv. 虚假地，不诚实地 n. (Mock) （美、德）莫克（人名）

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: boast
trans: vt. 夸口说，自吹自擂说；以有…而自豪 n. 自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物 vi. 自吹自擂 n. (Boast)人名；(英)博斯特

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: courtesy
trans: n. 礼貌；好意；恩惠 adj. 殷勤的；被承认的；出于礼节的

sentences.english: It’s a matter of common courtesy to acknowledge letters.
sentences.chinese: 确认收到来信是起码的礼貌。

sentences.english: The president paid a courtesy call on Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 总统礼节性地拜访了明仁天皇。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour and respect for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 殷勤的；被承认的；出于礼节的
detailed_translations.english: A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect

name: odor
trans: n. 气味；名声 n. (Odor)人名；(匈)欧多尔

sentences.english: I smelled the odor of money.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到了一股铜臭气。

sentences.english: The researchers demonstrate that it is possible to generate odor in a compact device that can fit on the back of a TV with potentially thousands of odors.
sentences.chinese: 研究员表示，将一个可以散发上千种气味的小型设备安装在电视背后，从而实现电视(根据情景)生成气味是可能的。

sentences.english: Pewter has an odor.
sentences.chinese: 锡器有一股臭气。

name: remorse
trans: n. 懊悔；同情

sentences.english: Throughout the trial, he had shown no remorse .
sentences.chinese: 整个审判过程中，他没有表示出一丝悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of being sorry that you have done something very bad

name: tolerate
trans: vt. 忍受；默许；宽恕

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

name: apologetic
trans: adj. 道歉的；赔罪的

sentences.english: The hospital staff were very apologetic but that couldn't really compensate.
sentences.chinese: 医院员工都深表歉意，但那不能真正补偿。

detailed_translations.english: If you are apologetic, you show or say that you are sorry for causing trouble for someone, for hurting them, or for disappointing them

name: dejected
trans: adj. 沮丧的，灰心的

sentences.english: The unemployed stood at street corners, dejected.
sentences.chinese: 失业者沮丧地站在街角。

detailed_translations.english: unhappy, disappointed, or sad

name: humiliation
trans: n. 丢脸，耻辱；蒙羞；谦卑

sentences.english: the humiliation of having to ask her parents for money
sentences.chinese: 不得不开口伸手向她父母要钱的难堪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of shame and great embarrassment, because you have been made to look stupid or weak

name: indignation
trans: n. 愤慨；愤怒；义愤

sentences.english: To his indignation, Charles found that his name was not on the list.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯发现他的名字没有出现在名单上，这让他深感愤慨。

sentences.english: He stormed into her office, full of righteous indignation.
sentences.chinese: 他义愤填膺，气呼呼地冲进她的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: feelings of anger and surprise because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

name: mortified
trans: adj. 窘迫的；受辱的 v. 使受辱（mortify的过去式）

name: overcome
trans: vt. 克服；胜过 vi. 克服；得胜

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: chapel
trans: n. 小礼拜堂，小教堂；礼拜 adj. 非国教的 n. (Chapel)人名；(法)沙佩尔；(英)查普尔

sentences.english: Bethan goes to chapel every Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 贝唐每个星期天都去教堂做礼拜。

detailed_translations.english: a small church, or a room in a hospital, prison, big church etc in which Christians pray and have religious services

name: chiseled
trans: adj. 轮廓分明的；凿刻的 v. 镌刻；用凿子刻（chisel的过去分词）

name: engrave
trans: vt. 雕刻；铭记

sentences.english: Your wedding ring can be engraved with a personal inscription at no extra cost.
sentences.chinese: 你的结婚戒指可以刻上个人题字不另收费。

sentences.english: The shop will also engrave your child's name on the side.
sentences.chinese: 商店也将在一侧刻上你孩子的名字。

sentences.english: ...a bottle engraved with her name.
sentences.chinese: …一个刻有她名字的瓶子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雕刻；  铭记， 深印于 ， 铭刻
detailed_translations.english: If you engrave something with a design or words, or if you engrave a design or words on it, you cut the design or words into its surface

name: indignant
trans: adj. 愤愤不平的；义愤的

sentences.english: an indignant reply
sentences.chinese: 愤慨的回复

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒的， 愤慨的， 义愤的
detailed_translations.english: angry and surprised because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

name: masterpiece
trans: n. 杰作；绝无仅有的人

sentences.english: Mary Shelley was just 18 when she wrote the horror masterpiece ‘Frankenstein’.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

detailed_translations.english: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

name: renowned
trans: adj. 著名的；有声望的 v. 使有声誉（renown的过去分词）

sentences.english: The area is renowned for its Romanesque churches.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区以其罗马式教堂闻名。

detailed_translations.english: known and admired by a lot of people, especially for a special skill, achievement, or quality

name: creature
trans: n. 动物，生物；人；创造物

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

name: defeat
trans: v. 击败；挫败（某人）；阻止达成（目的）；反对（动议或提议）；（使）无法理解；（使）无效 n. 失败；战胜

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

name: hybrid
trans: n. 杂种，混血儿；混合物 adj. 混合的；杂种的

sentences.english: hybrid architecture
sentences.chinese: 具有混合风格的建筑

sentences.english: ...the hybrid corn seed.
sentences.chinese: …杂交玉米种子。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced from parents of different breeds or types
Hybrid is also an adjective

name: myth
trans: n. 神话；虚构的人，虚构的事

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: symbolize
trans: vt. 象征；用符号表现 vi. 采用象征；使用符号；作为…的象征

sentences.english: Crime often symbolizes a wider social problem.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪问题往往反映出更广泛的社会问题。

sentences.english: Growing discontent has been symbolized by the protests.
sentences.chinese: 与日俱增的不满通过一次又一次的抗议表现出来。

detailed_translations.english: if something symbolizes a quality, feeling etc, it represents it

name: ban
trans: v. 禁止，取缔；（官方）把（某人）逐出某地 n. 禁止，禁令，禁忌；剥夺公民权的判决；诅咒；巴尼（罗马尼亚货币单位） n. (Ban) （美、罗马、克罗地亚）班恩（人名）

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: cause
trans: n. 原因；事业；目标 vt. 引起；使遭受

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

name: column
trans: n. 纵队，列；专栏；圆柱，柱形物

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议，反对；（多来自公证人）拒付证书 v. 抗议，反对；坚决表示，断言；拒付

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: dominant
trans: adj. 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的 n. 显性

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: endangered
trans: adj. 濒临灭绝的；有生命危险的

sentences.english: I think there are many endangered animals in the world, such as tigers and pandas.
sentences.chinese: 我认为有许多濒临灭绝的动物，如老虎和大熊猫，在世界。

sentences.english: I think our government should punish those people severely who kill the rare animals. It is our duty to protect the endangered animals.
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府应该严厉惩罚那些捕杀稀有动物的人。保护濒临灭绝的动物是我们的责任。

sentences.english: However, it holds six language families, two of which have only one remaining language, and almost all of the languages here are endangered.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它拥有六个语族，其中两个语族仅剩下一种语言，而且这儿几乎所有的语言都濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 濒危的， 将要灭绝的

name: gizzard
trans: n. （鸟的）[鸟] 砂囊；胃；喉咙

name: intimidate
trans: vt. 恐吓，威胁；胁迫

sentences.english: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

name: savanna
trans: n. [生态] 热带草原；热带的稀树大草原

name: atmosphere
trans: n. 气氛；大气；空气

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: diameter
trans: n. 直径

sentences.english: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

detailed_translations.english: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

name: meteor
trans: n. 流星；[气象] 大气现象

sentences.english: Astronomers track large meteors using radar.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家使用雷达跟踪大型流星。

sentences.english: a meteor shower
sentences.chinese: 流星雨

detailed_translations.chinese: 流星；[气象] 大气现象
detailed_translations.english: a piece of rock or metal that travels through space, and makes a bright line in the night sky when it falls down towards the Earth

name: meteorite
trans: n. 陨石，陨星；流星

sentences.english: I close the meteorite room and try the door across thecorridor.
sentences.chinese: 我关上陨石房间的门，又打开了走廊对面的门。

sentences.english: If the contamination were terrestrial, one could expect equal amounts of the molecules (or less) to be present in the meteorite samples, certainly not more.
sentences.chinese: 如果污染是来自地面的，在陨石样品中有可能会发现等量（或者较少）的分子，但肯定不会多。

sentences.english: The group, based at Imperial College London, found some of the base building blocks for life, nucleobases, in dust from the Murchison meteorite which fell to Earth in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 研究小组由伦敦帝国学院创建，他们在1969年坠入地球的默奇森陨石尘埃中发现了碱基，这是构建生命的基本成分。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of rock or metal from space that has landed on Earth

name: algae
trans: n. [植] 藻类；[植] 海藻

sentences.english: ...an effort to control toxic algae in Green Lake.
sentences.chinese: …控制绿湖里有毒水藻的努力。

detailed_translations.english: a very simple plant without stems or leaves that grows in or near water

name: insulation
trans: n. 绝缘；隔离，孤立

sentences.english: Good insulation can save you money on heating bills.
sentences.chinese: 好的隔热效果能节省暖气费。

detailed_translations.english: when something is insulated or someone insulates something

name: pollution
trans: n. 污染 污染物

sentences.english: California’s tough anti-pollution laws
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州严厉的反污染法

detailed_translations.english: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

name: streamlined
trans: adj. 流线型的；改进的；最新型的 v. 使成流线型；使合理化（streamline的过去式和过去分词）

name: appetizing
trans: adj. 开胃的；促进食欲的

sentences.english: an appetizing aroma
sentences.chinese: 令人垂涎的香味

sentences.english: The food wasn’t particularly appetizing.
sentences.chinese: 那些食物让人不是特别有胃口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 美味可口的， 促进食欲的
detailed_translations.english: food that is appetizing smells or looks very good, making you want to eat it

name: devour
trans: v. 吞食；毁灭

sentences.english: Her body had been almost entirely devoured by the disease.
sentences.chinese: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

detailed_translations.english: to destroy someone or something

name: peculiar
trans: adj. 特殊的；独特的；奇怪的；罕见的 n. 特权；特有财产

sentences.english: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近他有点怪异。

sentences.english: She’s a very peculiar child.
sentences.chinese: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way

name: savor
trans: vt. 尽情享受；使有风味；加调味品于；品尝，欣赏 vi. 有…的滋味；带有…的性质 n. 滋味；气味；食欲

sentences.english: Instead of feeling guilty, savor and love every bite -- you deserve it.
sentences.chinese: 不要有负罪感，享受并且珍爱每一次咀嚼的滋味——你值得拥有。

name: scrumptious
trans: adj. 美味的；绝妙的，极好的

sentences.english: a scrumptious chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 美味可口的巧克力蛋糕

sentences.english: That was absolutely scrumptious !
sentences.chinese: 那东西好吃极了！

detailed_translations.english: food that is scrumptious tastes very good

name: suspicious
trans: adj. 可疑的；怀疑的；多疑的

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.english: She gave him a suspicious glance.
sentences.chinese: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。

sentences.english: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
sentences.chinese: 你真是疑心太重！

detailed_translations.english: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: concentrated
trans: adj. 集中的；浓缩的；全神贯注的 v. 集中（concentrate的过去分词）

name: focus
trans: n. 焦点；中心；清晰；焦距 vt. 使集中；使聚焦 vi. 集中；聚焦；调节焦距 n. (Focus)人名；(瑞典)福库斯

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

name: reflection
trans: n. 反射；沉思；映象

sentences.english: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: refraction
trans: n. 折射；折光

sentences.english: If water had a negative index of refraction, then a straw placed in a glass would appear to bend back under itself.
sentences.chinese: 如果水具有负折射率，那么放在玻璃杯中的吸管似乎可能弯曲到自身下方。

sentences.english: With all that reflection and refraction, modernism creates the illusion that there is an illusion when in fact it is a straightforward statement of money and power.
sentences.chinese: 通过反射和折射，现代主义创造了一个幻觉存在的假象，而实际上它是对金钱和权力不加掩饰的声明。

sentences.english: Rapidly changing refraction due to turbulence along the line of sight affects different colors of light by different amounts and generally produces a twinkling effect for stars.
sentences.chinese: 由于湍流而快速变化的折射在视线中会影响到光的不同颜色，这种影响也各不相同，一般会给恒星产生一种闪烁的效果。

name: substance
trans: n. 物质；实质；资产；主旨

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

name: debunk
trans: vt. 揭穿；拆穿…的假面具；暴露

sentences.english: Historian Michael Beschloss debunks a few myths.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家迈克尔·贝斯切罗斯揭露了一些神话的真相。

detailed_translations.english: If you debunk a widely held belief, you show that it is false. If you debunk something that is widely admired, you show that it is not as good as people think it is.

name: disembark
trans: vi. 登陆，下车；上岸 vt. 使……登陆；使……上岸

sentences.english: I looked toward the plane. Six passengers had already disembarked.
sentences.chinese: 我向飞机看去。6名乘客已下机。

detailed_translations.english: to put people or goods onto the shore from a ship

name: lair
trans: n. （野兽的）[动] 巢穴；躲藏处 vi. 进入兽穴；在穴中休息 vt. 使陷入泥潭；放于穴中 n. (Lair)人名；(英、法)莱尔

sentences.english: a smuggler’s lair
sentences.chinese: 走私者的藏身处

detailed_translations.chinese: 窝， 巢穴； 躲藏处
detailed_translations.english: the place where a wild animal hides and sleeps

name: peat
trans: n. 泥煤；泥炭块；泥炭色 n. (Peat)人名；(英)皮特

sentences.english: Lean the plants against a wall and cover the roots with peat.
sentences.chinese: 把植物靠墙摆放，用泥煤盖住根部。 。

sentences.english: All you need is a large container with a cover, paper waste, peat moss, some water, and of course, worms.
sentences.chinese: 您所需的只是一个附盖的大容器、废弃纸类、泥煤苔、少许水份、当然还有蠕虫。

name: scour
trans: vi. 冲刷；擦；腹泻 vt. 擦亮，洗涤；冲洗，清除 n. 擦，冲刷；洗涤剂；（畜类等的）腹泻

sentences.english: Ada was scouring out the pans.
sentences.chinese: 阿达在擦锅。

detailed_translations.english: to clean something very thoroughly by rubbing it with a rough material

detailed_translations.chinese: 擦，冲刷；洗涤剂；（畜类等的）腹泻

trans: n. 声呐；声波定位仪（等于asdic） n. （Sonar）人名；（土）索纳尔

sentences.english: What good is a ship armed to the teeth if its radar and sonar are substandard?
sentences.chinese: 如果一艘武装到牙齿的舰船其雷达和声纳是不合格的，那能好到哪里？

sentences.english: In his work to develop radar, sonar and ultrasound he performed all the necessary tests and provided all the proofs required.
sentences.chinese: 在雷达、声纳和超声的开发工作中，他进行了所有的必要测试，并提供了所需的一切论证。

sentences.english: However, a spokesman for the Ministry of Defence said: 'The Royal Navy can confirm that they were not in the area using sonar and have not been for some time.
sentences.chinese: 英国国防部的一位发言人表示：“皇家海军能证明他们并没有在这一海域使用声纳，而且他们在这片水域逗留的时间也不长。

detailed_translations.english: equipment on a ship or  submarine  that uses  sound waves  to find out the position of objects under the water

name: delighted
trans: adj. 高兴的；令人愉快的；乐意的 v. （使）高兴，愉快（delight 的过去式及过去分词）

sentences.english: Her screams of delighted laughter filled the air.
sentences.chinese: 她喜悦的尖叫声在空中荡漾。

detailed_translations.english: very pleased and happy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…兴高采烈；感到快乐（delight的过去分词）

name: errand
trans: n. 使命；差事；差使

sentences.english: Everybody rushing about on some incomprehensible errand someone forced him to do at pain of death.
sentences.chinese: 大家都忍受着死亡的痛苦被迫地抢着做一些令人难以理解的差事。

sentences.english: They can view a list of errands that match their interest profile, and, by entering a price, can bid to perform the errand.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以查看与他们的兴趣简档匹配的差事列表，并且，通过输入价格，可以为执行差事投标。

sentences.english: Get them a drink or a coffee, do a chore for them, offer to do an errand, anything they’d appreciate, really.
sentences.chinese: 为人递上一杯饮料或咖啡，做一些零星杂务，为别人提供一份差使等等使人感激的事情。 真的。

name: fetch
trans: vt. 取来；接来；到达；吸引 vi. 拿；取物；卖得 n. 取得；诡计

sentences.english: Sylvia fetched a towel from the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅从浴室拿来一条毛巾。

sentences.english: Fetch me a glass of water.
sentences.chinese: 给我拿杯水来。

detailed_translations.english: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are

name: master
trans: n. 主人；大师；硕士；男教师；原件；院长；主宰者；船长；著名画家；少爷；桅船 v. 精通；控制；征服；制作……母版 adj. 主人的；主要的；熟练的；原始版的 n. (Master) 马斯特（人名）

sentences.english: a work of art by a true master
sentences.chinese: 一件真正的大师之作

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: Master of Arts/Science/Education etc

detailed_translations.english: someone who is very skilled at something

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机 vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理 vi. 设计；建造

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: landmark
trans: n. [航]陆标；地标；界标；里程碑；纪念碑；地界标；划时代的事 adj. 有重大意义或影响的 n. （瑞典、挪）兰德马克（人名）

name: scholar
trans: n. 学者；奖学金获得者

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

name: skyline
trans: n. 地平线；空中轮廓线；架空索 vt. 天空映衬出…的轮廓

sentences.english: the famous New York skyline
sentences.chinese: 著名的纽约天际线

detailed_translations.chinese: 地平线；空中轮廓线；架空索
detailed_translations.english: the shape made by hills or buildings against the sky

name: waterway
trans: n. 航道；水路；排水沟

sentences.english: There are more than 400 miles of waterways to explore in the area.
sentences.chinese: 此地有400多英里的航道有待勘察。

detailed_translations.english: a river or canal that boats travel on

trans: n. 运动；活动；战役，军事行动；竞选 v. 领导或参加运动；参加竞选

sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: candidate
trans: n. 候选人，候补者；应试者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

name: era
trans: n. 时代；年代；纪元 n. (Era)人名；(意、芬、印)埃拉

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: legislature
trans: n. 立法机关；立法机构

sentences.english: The proposals before the legislature include the creation of two special courts to deal exclusively with violent crimes.
sentences.chinese: 摆在议会面前的提案包括建立两个特殊法庭专门审理暴力犯罪案件。

detailed_translations.english: an institution that has the power to make or change laws

name: nomination
trans: n. 任命，提名；提名权

sentences.english: All the committee’s nominations were approved.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会的所有提名均获得批准。

detailed_translations.english: the act of officially suggesting someone or something for a position, duty or prize, or the fact of being suggested for it

name: antivenin
trans: n. 抗蛇毒素；抗蛇毒血清

trans: vt. 注入；注射

sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: exploration
trans: n. 探测；探究；踏勘

sentences.english: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
sentences.chinese: 北海的石油勘探设施

sentences.english: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
sentences.chinese: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营，去周围的山里探险。

detailed_translations.english: a person who roves; wanderer

trans: n. 模拟器；假装者，模拟者

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that is able to travel in space

sentences.chinese: 实习生下周开始上班。

sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

name: mythology

sentences.english: characters from classical mythology
sentences.chinese: 古典神话中的人物

detailed_translations.english: set of ancient myths

name: Norse
trans: adj. 挪威的；挪威人的；斯堪的纳维亚语的 n. 挪威人；挪威语

trans: n. 骗子；魔术师

sentences.english: There have been various wagers on certain candidates since the senator announced his retirement.
sentences.chinese: 自从那位参议员宣布引退之后，对某些候选人的打赌猜测纷纷出现。

name: demand

sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

name: fluctuate
trans: vi. 波动；涨落；动摇 vt. 使波动；使动摇

sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

trans: n. 影响；势力；感化；有影响的人或事 vt. 影响；改变

sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

trans: n. 商品；货物 vt. 买卖；推销 vi. 经商

sentences.chinese: 一系列正版的迪士尼商品在出售。

sentences.english: They inspected the merchandise carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他们仔细地检查了商品。

detailed_translations.english: goods that are being sold

name: product
trans: n. 产品；结果；[数] 乘积；作品

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

name: supply
trans: n. 供给，补给；供应品 vt. 供给，提供；补充 vi. 供给；替代

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

name: dire
trans: adj. 可怕的；悲惨的；极端的

sentences.english: warnings of dire consequences that often don’t come true
sentences.chinese: 对严重后果的警告，尽管这些后果常常不会出现

sentences.english: The country is in dire need of food aid.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家急需食品援助。

sentences.english: The situation looked dire.
sentences.chinese: 情况看来非常严重。

detailed_translations.english: extremely serious or terrible

name: magnificent
trans: adj. 高尚的；壮丽的；华丽的；宏伟的

sentences.english: The magnificent beau is dancing to the light of chandeliers.
sentences.chinese: 这个衣着华丽的花花公子在枝形吊灯灯光下翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: These magnificent ancient buildings demonstrate the great intelligence of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这些壮丽的古代建筑显示了劳动人民的高度智慧。

name: steerage
