name: electronic
trans: adj. 电子的 n. 电子电路；电子器件

sentences.english: electronic games
sentences.chinese: 电子游戏

sentences.english: an electronic organizer (= a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc )
sentences.chinese: 电子记事本

detailed_translations.english: electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc

name: interact
trans: vt. 互相影响；互相作用 vi. 互相影响；互相作用 n. 幕间剧；幕间休息

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: relationship
trans: n. 关系；关联

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: devastating
trans: adj. 毁灭性的；全然的 v. 摧毁（devastate的ing形式）；毁坏

sentences.english: It will be a devastating blow for the town if the factory closes.
sentences.chinese: 如果工厂关闭，对该镇来说将是沉重的打击。

detailed_translations.english: badly damaging or destroying something

name: earthquake
trans: n. 地震；大动荡

sentences.english: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
sentences.chinese: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。

sentences.english: The city is in an earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 该市位于地震带。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

name: evacuation
trans: n. 疏散；撤离；排泄

sentences.english: I ordered the evacuation of all Americans and sent troops to guarantee their safety.
sentences.chinese: 我下令撤离所有的美国人，并派部队去保证他们的安全。

sentences.english: The impact of evacuation and relocation on those with health or functional impairments can be tremendous .
sentences.chinese: 撤离和重新安置对这些健康状况欠佳或身体残疾的人影响极大。

sentences.english: However, it is not only harmful to escape, but also beneficial for smoke to spread quickly to other floors if the smoke moves into the vertical escape evacuation routes while it is on fire.
sentences.chinese: 但是火灾发生后，作为人员逃生的竖向疏散通道如果遭受烟气侵害，不仅对人员的逃生不利，而且会加快烟气向其他楼层的蔓延。

name: fault
trans: n. 故障；[地质] 断层；错误；缺点；毛病；（网球等）发球失误 vi. 弄错；产生断层 vt. （通常用于疑问句或否定句）挑剔

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

name: siren
trans: n. 汽笛；迷人的女人；歌声动人的女歌手 adj. 迷人的 vi. 响着警报器行驶 vt. 引诱

sentences.english: the wail of the ambulance sirens
sentences.chinese: 救护车汽笛的尖啸

sentences.english: I heard police sirens in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我听到了远处的警笛声。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes very loud warning sounds, used on police cars, fire engines etc

sentences.chinese: 你能从电视上海啸和地震的生还者的脸上看到这点。

sentences.english: They urged other town residents unaffected by the quake and tsunami to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 他们敦促其他没有受到地震和海啸影响的城镇居民也这样做。

sentences.english: But I am lucky because we did get a little bit of the tsunami but nothing like what they got up north.
sentences.chinese: 但我算是幸运的因为我们这只受到了海啸很小的侵害远不及北方所受到的那样。

name: crater
trans: n. 火山口；弹坑 vt. 在…上形成坑；取消；毁坏 vi. 形成坑；消亡

sentences.english: craters on the moon’s surface
sentences.chinese: 月球表面的坑

detailed_translations.english: a round hole in the ground made by something that has fallen on it or by an explosion

name: dormant
trans: adj. 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的 n. (Dormant)人名；(法)多尔芒

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: lava
trans: n. 火山岩浆；火山所喷出的熔岩 n. (Lava)人名；(西、意)拉瓦

sentences.english: Mexico's Mount Colima began spewing lava and ash last night.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥科利马山昨晚开始喷发熔岩和火山灰。

detailed_translations.english: hot liquid rock that flows from a volcano,or this rock when it has become solid

name: magma
trans: n. [地质] 岩浆；糊剂 n. (Magma)人名；(英)马格马

sentences.english: The volcano threw new showers of magma and ash into the air.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

detailed_translations.english: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth

name: plate
trans: n. 碟；金属板；金属牌；感光底片 vt. 电镀；给…装甲 n. (Plate)人名；(英、德、俄、西、意、瑞典)普拉特

sentences.english: The plates were piled high with rice.
sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.english: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

detailed_translations.english: flat and usually round dish that you eat from or serve food on
to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver

name: explore
trans: vt. 探索；探测；探险 vi. 探索；探测；探险

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；工具；乐器；手段；器械 v. 给……装测量仪器

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道 vt. 派遣；向……传教

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: probe
trans: n. 探针；调查 vi. 调查；探测 vt. 探查；用探针探测 n. (Probe)人名；(法)普罗布

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: despise
trans: vt. 轻视，鄙视

sentences.english: She despised her neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 她看不起她的邻居。

detailed_translations.english: to dislike and have a low opinion of someone or something

name: invade
trans: vt. 侵略；侵袭；侵扰；涌入 vi. 侵略；侵入；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: kingdom
trans: n. 王国；界；领域 n. (Kingdom)人名；(英)金德姆

sentences.english: the United Kingdom
sentences.chinese: 联合王国

sentences.english: the animal/plant/mineral kingdom
sentences.chinese: 动物界/植物界/矿物界〔大自然三界〕

detailed_translations.english: a country ruled by a king or queen

name: regret
trans: vt. 后悔；对……感到遗憾；礼貌或正式地表示惋惜或抱歉；对（损失或缺乏）感到痛惜 vi. 遗憾 n. 遗憾，歉意

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: ruffian
trans: n. 恶棍；流氓；无赖 adj. 残暴的；凶恶的；无法无天的

sentences.english: a gang of ruffians
sentences.chinese: 一伙流氓

detailed_translations.english: a violent man, involved in crime

detailed_translations.chinese: 残暴的；凶恶的；无法无天的

name: analyze
trans: vt. 对…进行分析，分解（等于analyse）

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

name: discovery
trans: n. 发现，发觉；被发现的事物

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

name: method
trans: n. 方法；条理；类函数 adj. 使用体验派表演方法的

sentences.english: traditional teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 传统的教学法

sentences.english: I think we should try again using a different method.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们应该用不同的方法再试一次。

sentences.english: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
sentences.chinese: 信息存储和检索的有效方法

detailed_translations.english: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use

name: mysterious
trans: adj. 神秘的；不可思议的；难解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: commitment
trans: n. 承诺，保证；委托；承担义务；献身

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

name: disappoint
trans: vt. 使失望

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: fascinating
trans: adj. 迷人的；吸引人的；使人神魂颠倒的 v. 使…着迷；使…陶醉（fascinate的ing形式）

sentences.english: a fascinating book
sentences.chinese: 一本引人入胜的书

sentences.english: That sounds absolutely fascinating .
sentences.chinese: 那听起来极具吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷人的， 有极大吸引力的
detailed_translations.english: extremely interesting

name: frustrated
trans: adj. 懊恼的，沮丧的；无效的，没有得到满足的；失意的，不得志的；（性欲）被抑制的 v. 挫败；阻挠（frustrate 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: He gets frustrated when people don’t understand what he’s trying to say.
sentences.chinese: 人们不懂他在说什么时，他就会很懊丧。

sentences.english: The government has deliberately frustrated his efforts to gain work permits for his foreign staff.
sentences.chinese: 政府蓄意挫败了他为其外国员工取得工作许可证的努力。

detailed_translations.english: someone who wants to develop a particular skill but has not been able to do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫败；阻挠（frustrate的过去式和过去分词形式）
detailed_translations.english: If someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者；志愿兵 adj. 志愿的 vi. 自愿 vt. 自愿

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: harass
trans: v. 骚扰，（使）困扰（或烦恼）；反复袭击

sentences.english: A number of black youths have complained of being harassed by the police.
sentences.chinese: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困扰；使烦恼；反复袭击
detailed_translations.english: to make someone’s life unpleasant, for example by frequently saying offensive things to them or threatening them

name: irrigation
trans: n. 灌溉；[临床] 冲洗；冲洗法

sentences.english: Small blockages or collapses of the canal would choke the intricate irrigation networks.
sentences.chinese: 运河的小堵塞或倒塌都会阻塞整个负责的灌溉网络。

sentences.english: In the United States, by contrast, 41% goes for agriculture, almost all of it for irrigation.
sentences.chinese: 与之相比，美国全年41%的水投向了农业，并几乎全都用在了灌溉上。

sentences.english: Spray irrigation sprinkling water over land to be used for crops. often used to dispose of wastewater from sewage treatment plants.
sentences.chinese: 喷洒灌溉，喷灌把水喷洒于准备种植作物的土地上。常常使用经过污水厂处理过的废水。

name: mutter
trans: vi. 咕哝；喃喃自语 vt. 咕哝；抱怨地说；低声含糊地说 n. 咕哝；喃喃低语 n. (Mutter)人名；(法)米泰；(德、匈、西)穆特；(英)马特

sentences.english: Elsie muttered something I couldn’t catch and walked off.
sentences.chinese: 埃尔茜咕哝了一句什么，我也没有听懂，她就走掉了。

sentences.english: ‘He’s such an unpleasant man,’ Alyssia muttered under her breath .
sentences.chinese: “他真是个讨厌的人。”阿莉西娅轻声嘟囔着。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in a low voice, especially because you are annoyed about something, or you do not want people to hear you

name: ominous
trans: adj. 预兆的；不吉利的

sentences.english: ‘How long will she be ill?’ he asked. There was an ominous silence.
sentences.chinese: “她的病多久会好？”他问。大家的沉默让人感觉不妙。

sentences.english: The car is making an ominous rattling sound.
sentences.chinese: 汽车在发出一种不妙的咔嗒声。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel that something bad is going to happen

name: taunt
trans: v. 奚落，逗弄 n. 嘲弄（话），讥讽（话） adj. 很高的

sentences.english: racist taunts
sentences.chinese: 种族主义嘲讽言论

detailed_translations.english: a remark or joke intended to make someone angry or upset
to try to make someone angry or upset by saying unkind things to them

name: tradition
trans: n. 惯例，传统；传说

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: function
trans: n. 功能；[数] 函数；职责；盛大的集会 vi. 运行；活动；行使职责

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: reorganize
trans: vt. 整理；改组；重新制定 vi. 整顿；改编

sentences.english: Our office is being completely reorganized.
sentences.chinese: 我们办公室正在彻底改组。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange or organize something in a new way

name: restore
trans: vt. 恢复；修复；归还 vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: schedule
trans: n. 计划（表）；时间表；一览表；（电视或广播）节目表；课程表；报税单；附件（尤指表格、单据等） v. 安排，预定；将……列入计划表或清单；把（建筑物）列为文物保护单位

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: shuffle
trans: v. 拖着脚走；把脚动来动去；坐立不安；洗牌；把……变换位置；调动；搪塞 n. 洗牌；拖着脚走，曳行；曳步舞，曳步动作；改组；慢切分节奏；随机播放装置

sentences.english: Is it my turn to shuffle?
sentences.chinese: 轮到我洗牌了吗？

sentences.english: Just shuffle the cards .
sentences.chinese: 请洗牌吧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗牌；推诿，推卸；拖曳，慢吞吞地走；搅乱
detailed_translations.english: to mix  playing card s  into a different order before playing a game with them

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗牌，洗纸牌；混乱，蒙混；拖着脚走
detailed_translations.english: a slow walk in which you do not lift your feet off the ground

name: extension
trans: n. 延长；延期；扩大；伸展；电话分机

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: ornate
trans: adj. 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的

sentences.english: an ornate gold mirror
sentences.chinese: 华丽的金镜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的
detailed_translations.english: covered with a lot of decoration

name: toupee
trans: n. 假发；男子假发

name: wealthy
trans: adj. 富有的；充分的；丰裕的 n. 富人

sentences.english: the wealthy nations of the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上的富国

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of money, possessions etc

name: wig
trans: n. 假发；要人；头脑 vt. 使戴假发；斥责 vi. 激动；发狂 n. (Wig)人名；(英、瑞典)威格；(德)维希

sentences.english: Jo wore a long wig that made her look very sexy.
sentences.chinese: 乔带着一头长长的假发，使她看起来很性感。

detailed_translations.english: artificial hair that you wear on your head

name: attempt
trans: n. 企图，试图；攻击 vt. 企图，试图；尝试

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

name: crevasse
trans: n. 裂缝；破口，崩溃处

name: crouch
trans: v. 蹲伏；俯身接近 n. 蹲着的姿势 n. (Crouch) （美）克劳奇（人名）

sentences.english: He crouched in the shadows near the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他蹲在门道近旁的阴暗处。

sentences.english: Paula crouched down and held her hands out to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉蹲下来，把手伸向火堆。

sentences.english: They walked in a crouch, each bent over close to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他们蹲伏着行走，一个个弯着腰快要贴着地面了。

detailed_translations.english: to lower your body close to the ground by bending your knees completely
Crouch is also a noun

name: isolated
trans: adj. 偏远的；孤立的；孤独的；单独的； 绝缘的 v. 使……孤立；使……分离；将……剔出（isolate 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: small isolated communities
sentences.chinese: 偏僻的小社区

sentences.english: Not many people visit this isolated spot.
sentences.chinese: 没有多少人到这个偏僻的地方来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 隔离的， 分离的； 与世隔绝的， 偏僻的； 孤立的， 孤独的； 个别的
detailed_translations.english: an isolated building, village etc is far away from any others

name: migration
trans: n. 迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work
